bug.author: marcespie
bug.summary: Python bindings setup assumes too many things
bug.description:
Around line 40 of setup.py.in: <denchmark-code> # CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS seems to have an extra space. extra_compile_args=('-DBINDING_TYPE=BINDING_TYPE_PYX ' + \ '-std=c++11${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS}').split(' '), </denchmark-code>
nope, it doesn't. Not always. Funny seeing my compiler trying to build with -std=c++11-O2 and right after that: extra_link_args=['${OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS}'], turns into a magnificent NOT FOUND while building extensions. I have no idea (yet) whether OpenMP is required for python bindings, or whether a specific build configuration accidentally has it. If it's required, the main CMakeLists.txt logic should then proceed to disable python extensions...

comments.comment: I can confirm that the python bindings build just fine without ${OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS} on a !OpenMP installation...

Ah, thanks. I think that the two issues you've encountered here are related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1478>#1478</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1425>#1425</denchmark-link> , respectively. In both of those cases, it was problematic to come up with fixes because we couldn't directly reproduce them. Can you try the patch in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1478>#1478</denchmark-link> and see if that works for you? If so, then I'd be happy to commit that. And for the OpenMP CXXFLAGS bit, I bet this is what was going wrong in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1425>#1425</denchmark-link> , so thanks for pointing it out. We can probably do the following... in , change the block at line 360 from: <denchmark-code>if (OPENMP_FOUND) add_definitions(-DHAS_OPENMP) set(CMAKE_C_FLAGS "${CMAKE_C_FLAGS} ${OpenMP_C_FLAGS}") set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS}") else () # Disable warnings for all the unknown OpenMP pragmas. set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wno-unknown-pragmas") endif () </denchmark-code>
to <denchmark-code>if (OPENMP_FOUND) add_definitions(-DHAS_OPENMP) set(CMAKE_C_FLAGS "${CMAKE_C_FLAGS} ${OpenMP_C_FLAGS}") set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS}") else () # Disable warnings for all the unknown OpenMP pragmas. set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wno-unknown-pragmas") set(OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS "") endif () </denchmark-code>
If that works, I'll open a PR with these two fixes and also the ones from the other issues you've opened. Thanks again for the reports, these are all great things to get fixed. üëç
